io.flic.lib

Class FlicManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.flic.lib.FlicManager

  • public final class FlicManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Flic Manager. This is a singleton class used to communicate with the Flic Application. Use getInstance(Context, FlicManagerInitializedCallback, FlicManagerUninitializedCallback) or getInstance(Context, FlicManagerInitializedCallback) to retrieve a manager.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GRAB_BUTTON_REQUEST_CODE
      Request code used in the grab button flow.

      • GRAB_BUTTON_REQUEST_CODE

        public static final int GRAB_BUTTON_REQUEST_CODE
        Request code used in the grab button flow.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setAppCredentials

        public static void setAppCredentials(java.lang.String appId,
                     java.lang.String appSecret,
                     java.lang.String appName)
        Set the App credentials. The credentials can only be set once. Setting them again is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        appId - App ID
        appSecret - App Secret
        appName - App name that will be shown to the user in the Flic App

      • getInstance

        public static void getInstance(Context context,
               FlicManagerInitializedCallback initializedCallback)
        Get the singleton instance of the manager.
        Parameters:
        context - An application/service/activity context. Context#getApplicationContext() on this object will be the context to use.
        initializedCallback - A callback that will be called with the manager as parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context or initializedCallback is null.
        AppCredentialsNotProvidedException - If App credentials were not provided. See setAppCredentials(String, String, String).
        FlicAppNotInstalledException - If the Flic Application is not installed.

      • getInstance

        public static void getInstance(Context context,
               FlicManagerInitializedCallback initializedCallback,
               FlicManagerUninitializedCallback uninitializedCallback)
        Get the singleton instance of the manager.
        Parameters:
        context - An application/service/activity context. Context#getApplicationContext() on this object will be the context to use.
        initializedCallback - A callback that will be called with the manager as parameter.
        uninitializedCallback - If non-null, a callback that will be called if the Flic Application exits, or when destroyInstance() is called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If context or initializedCallback is null.
        AppCredentialsNotProvidedException - If App credentials were not provided. See setAppCredentials(String, String, String).
        FlicAppNotInstalledException - If the Flic Application is not installed.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Is initialized.
        Returns:
        true if the manager has been initialized.

      • destroyInstance

        public static void destroyInstance()
        Clean resources and unregister all callbacks. Use getInstance(Context, io.flic.lib.FlicManagerInitializedCallback) to re-initialize.

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object

      • getButtonByDeviceId

        public FlicButton getButtonByDeviceId(java.lang.String deviceId)
        Get a button by its Bluetooth device address.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - The Bluetooth device address case insensitive.
        Returns:
        A button object or null if it has not been grabbed before.

      • getKnownButtons

        public java.util.List<FlicButton> getKnownButtons()
        Get a copy of the internal list of buttons. This is a list of all previously grabbed buttons that have not been removed.
        Returns:
        The list

      • initiateGrabButton

        public void initiateGrabButton(Activity currentActivity)
        Initiate a grab button sequence. Call this method to ask the Flic app to retrieve a button object. This calls startActivityForResult with the request code GRAB_BUTTON_REQUEST_CODE. The result retrieved in onActivityResult for currentActivity must be sent to the completeGrabButton method.
        Parameters:
        currentActivity - The current activity initiating the button grabbing.

      • completeGrabButton

        public FlicButton completeGrabButton(int requestCode,
                            int resultCode,
                            Intent data)
        Completes a grab button sequence. Call this from Activity#onActivityResult(int, int, Intent).
        Parameters:
        data - An intent received by onActivityResult
        Returns:
        The grabbed FlicButton, null on failure, if requestCode wasn't GRAB_BUTTON_REQUEST_CODE or if resultCode was not Activity#RESULT_OK.

      • forgetButton

        public void forgetButton(FlicButton button)
        Forget button. Disposes a button object and removes it from the internal list of known buttons. You will no longer get callbacks for this button.
        Parameters:
        button - A button
